com.novell.ldapchai.cr
Interface ResponseSet

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractResponseSet, ChaiResponseSet
public interface ResponseSet

A representation of the responses part of challenge/response set. RespnseSets include an embedded ChallengeSet. This means that a full copy of the challenges are embedded at the response set, and a seperate challenge set instance is not required to test responses.

Response sets are associated to a user.

The underlying implementation may pull all response information into memory at time of creation, or there may be directory communication required for operation of methods on this interface.

Instances of ResponseSet can be created or read using ChaiCrFactory.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

meetsChallengeSetRequirements

boolean meetsChallengeSetRequirements(ChallengeSet challengeSet)
                                      throws ChaiValidationException
Tests the ResponseSet to see if it meets the requirements of the supplied ChallengeSet. This method does not test any response values.

A typical use case for this method is to validate if an existing, stored com.novell.ldapchai.cr.ResponseSet of a user satisfies a current com.novell.ldapchai.cr.ChallengeSet policy.

Parameters:
challengeSet - A valid ChallengeSet
Returns:
true if this ResponseSet meets the requirements of the challenge set.
Throws:
ChaiValidationException - if this response set does not meet the requirements of the challenge set

stringValue

String stringValue()
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                          ChaiOperationException
Get the literal string value of this ResponseSet. Not all types of ResponseSet's support this operation, in which case a UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown if the implementation doesn't support a string representation.

Returns:
The string representation of this ResponseSet
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the implementation does not support a string view of the response set.
ChaiOperationException

test

boolean test(Map<Challenge,String> responseTest)
             throws ChaiUnavailableException
Test the returned response set.

Note: There is no implementation (yet) for testing NMAS response sets. Attempting to test an NMAS ResponseSet will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

Parameters:
responseTest - a map containing Challenges as keys and String response values to use for testing.
Returns:
true if the responses pass the test
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
UnsupportedOperationException - if the implementation does not support a test operation.

getLocale

Locale getLocale()
                 throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                        IllegalStateException,
                        ChaiOperationException
Get the locale of the response set. A response set is always stored with a single locale.

Returns:
the Locale used to save the response set.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the write operation
IllegalStateException - if this response set is not suitable for writing, for example, if it has already been written, or was obtained by reading from ldap

                  throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                         IllegalStateException,
                         ChaiOperationException
Get the timestamp of the response. Generally indicates when the responseset was created.

Returns:
the Locale used to save the response set.
Throws:

ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the write operation
IllegalStateException - if this response set is not suitable for writing, for example, if it has already been written, or was obtained by reading from ldap

getHelpdeskResponses

Map<Challenge,String> getHelpdeskResponses()
Return the helpdesk challenge responses. The helpdesk challenge response answers are stored in reversable format to be used by helpdesk administrators. The answers can be used to help verify the identity of users when authenticating over the phone to a helpdesk or other 3rd party.

Returns:
